result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Winston Earl Wilcowski

records.addlTxt: Filed by ADA Damrau. arc   e: Atty Satorius.

1:17 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Winston Earl Wilcowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Winston Earl Wilcowski.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for PH.  Atty Satorius states he discussed what this hearing is for, it is DE's wish to waive PH.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Satorius believes the State is filling the Information which will mirror complaint, DE is willing to proceed to ARGN today.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NGP on all counts.  Court orders the State to provide discovery within the next 10 business days.  Atty Satorius waives speedy trial demand. Court schedules next hearing. Adjourned at 1:27 PM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:15 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Winston Earl Wilcowski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Winston Earl Wilcowski.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case without DE being present, Court believes Court services was unaware DE is in custody.  Court continues to find good cause and extends time for prelim schedules matter for PH. Adjourned at 10:22 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Court reviews file and notes DE does qualify for PD but attorney has not been appointed.  Court schedules this out and finds good cause to set this out to appoint an attorney.  Adjourned at 10:33 AM. bph

Status conference on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:02 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Thomas Michael Pisillo in court without an attorney, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM274 (PTC) & 22CF609 (PH).  Court reviews file and notes DE does not have an attorney at this time.  DE brought up PFAC but believes he lost his job and doesn't have a place to live now.  Court asks DE to meet with PD today.  Court finds good cause to push this matter out.  DE questions the ability to make payments towards child support while in custody, Court states Child Support agency will be notified.  Adjourned at 9:06 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

The original document was titled: Pretrial assessment report
The original history event date is: 09-07-2022

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Minors under age of 18 (solicited contact, if contact with minor while at work Defendant to be monitored).  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

No internet use unless it's work related or to obtain an attorney. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:03 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Winston Earl Wilcowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Winston Earl Wilcowski.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE does not qualify for PD.  DE confirms address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Bond argument.  Court sets bond.  DE given PFAC. Adjourned at 1:35 PM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
